intro: Tithymalus officinarum, commonly known as the common tithymale, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms from June to August. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable addition to gardens and meadows. Its fragrant flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
